title: Upper Darby holds off Conestoga, 25-22
text:
More coverage: Southeastern Pa. high school sports The Royals improved to 5-1 overall and 3-0 in Central League action. Conestoga slipped to 3-3 and 2-2. 
Down the stretch, the Pioneers threatened to pull off the comeback. But a holding penalty negated Tim Miller's 21-yard TD pass with a little over a minute remaining. And on fourth down from the Upper Darby 37, Tyler George's sack of Miller forced a fumble that lineman Malakhi Maddox recovered at the 48. 
For Conestoga, Corey Manning, who also has a bruising running style, carried 28 times for 200 yards and a pair of scores. 
Royals quarterback Christoff Minott threw for 212 yards and two TDs. Late in the second quarter, his 75-yard connection with wideout Brandon Morton made it 19-On the second play after intermission, Manning found a seam and dashed 58 yards to cut Upper Darby's lead to 19-7. 
After the Pioneers' defense forced a three-and-out on the ensuing series, Manning rumbled 43 yards to the Royals' 16. Five plays later, Miller connected with Pete Jean for a 7-yard TD. 
Upper Darby's botched center snap on a punt attempt then gave Conestoga the ball 11 yards from pay dirt. After a pass-interference call against the hosts, Manning went five yards to give the Pioneers a 22-19 advantage. 
Conestoga 0 0 22 0 - 22 
Upper Darby 6 13 6 0 - 25 
UD: Isaiah Bruce 39 run (kick failed) 
UD: Brandon Morton 75 pass from Christoff Minott (Derrick Korboi kick) 
UD: Bruce 57 pass from Minott (kick failed) 
C: Corey Manning 58 run (Christopher Smith kick) 
C: Peter Jean 7 pass from Tim Miller (Smith kick) 
C: Manning 6 run (Jean pass from Miller) 
UD: Bruce 68 run (kick blocked)
